newsitem.title: USA: Enron to buy Queen Sand stake.
newsitem.headline: Enron to buy Queen Sand stake.

text.p: Enron Corp said Enron Finance Corp will acquire a 33 percent interest in Queen Sand Resources Inc with the purchase of 9.6 million preferred shares for $5 million in cash plus future contingent cash payments of up to $9.4 million.

Enron said the the preferred shares are convertible into 9.6 million QSR common shares, preemptive rights and the right to common stock purchase warrants which, if exercised, would permit Enron to maintain a 33 percent stake in QSR.
Concurrently with the Enron investment, QSR will purchase 9.6 million common shares from Forseti Investments Ltd.
QSR will pay Forseti $5 million in cash, warrants to purchase 3 million common shares and futured contingent cash payments of up to $9.4 million.
The warrants will be exercisable prior to December 31, 1998, Enron said. The contingent future cash payments would only be payable from the contingent future payments from Enron.
At June 30, 1996, QSR had total proved reserves of 9.1 million barrels of oil equivalent.
Enron said QSR now estimates production at 545 barrels of oil equivalent per day, and operating revenues at $375,000 per month.
